data.title: Vehicle Overtaking
data.solution:
def can_overtake(L1, L2, V1_kmh, V2_kmh, S):
    # Convert speeds from km/h to m/s
    V1_mps = (V1_kmh * 1000) / 3600
    V2_mps = (V2_kmh * 1000) / 3600

    # Calculate the speed difference
    speed_difference = V1_mps - V2_mps

    # Total length to cover while overtaking
    total_length = L1 + L2

    # Calculate the time to overtake if possible
    if speed_difference > 0:
        time_to_overtake = total_length / speed_difference

        # Distance traveled by your truck during this time
        distance_travelled = V1_mps * time_to_overtake

        # Check if the distance travelled is within the available straight road
        if distance_travelled <= S:
            return f"{distance_travelled:.2f}"  # Return distance rounded to 2 decimal places
        else:
            return "Impossible"
    else:
        return "Impossible"  # If you are not faster, overtaking is impossible

# Example usage
var = input().split()

l1 = int(var[0])
l2 = int(var[1])
v1 = int(var[2])
v2 = int(var[3])
s = int(var[4])

result = can_overtake(l1, l2, v1, v2, s)
print(result)
data.statement: You are driving on a two-lane road where overtaking is only possible on [[s]] m straight sections of the road. Both vehicles have different speeds [[v1]], [[v2]]. Your task is to calculate the total distance you need to travel in order to fully overtake the other vehicle, taking into account the lengths of both vehicles [[l1]],[[l2]].

testCases.title: another risk on long straight road

data.stubGenerator:
read l1:int l2:int v1:int v2:int s:int 
write answer
data.inputDescription:
A single line containingfive space-separated integers:
[[l1]]: the length of your vehicle (in m).
[[l2]]: the length of the vehicle ahead (in m).
[[v1]]: the speed of your vehicle (in km/h).
[[v2]]: the speed of the vehicle ahead (in km/h)
[[s]]: the length of the straight road available for overtaking (in m).
data.outputDescription:
The total distance (in m) you need to travel to completely overtake the vehicle, rounded to two decimal places.
If the overtaking is not possible within the available straight road, output {{Impossible}}.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are driving on a two-lane road where overtaking is only possible on s m straight sections of the road. Both vehicles have different speeds v1, v2. Your task is to calculate the total distance you need to travel in order to fully overtake the other vehicle, taking into account the lengths of both vehicles l1,l2.
Input
A single line containingfive space-separated integers:
l1: the length of your vehicle (in m).
l2: the length of the vehicle ahead (in m).
v1: the speed of your vehicle (in km/h).
v2: the speed of the vehicle ahead (in km/h)
s: the length of the straight road available for overtaking (in m).
Output
The total distance (in m) you need to travel to completely overtake the vehicle, rounded to two decimal places.
If the overtaking is not possible within the available straight road, output Impossible.
Constraints
1 ≤ l1,l2 ≤ 1000
1 ≤ v1,v2 ≤ 1000
Example
Input
3 4 100 90 500
Output
70.00
